title: The Brexit flash points to watch in the Parliamentary debate
text:
Even with a deal agreed with Brussels, the route to leaving on October 31 is filled with hurdles. Here are the key Brexit flash points to watch:

Brexit timetable

MPs have responded with “outrage” over the proposed timetable the government has suggested for the legislation. The proposed “programme motion” seeks to push the Withdrawal Agreement Bill through the Commons in three days before taking it to the House of Lords.

The Commons has to approve the timetable and many MPs, including Rory Stewart, Ken Clarke and Dominic Grieve, have said they will oppose it and push for more time to consider the Bill. This would make leaving the EU by Oct 31 next to impossible and will likely require a “technical”...
description: Even with a deal agreed with Brussels, the route to leaving on October 31 is filled with hurdles.
